intro: Anguillaria biglandulosa, commonly known as the two-lobed sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Capparaceae family, which includes various shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and fleshy, succulent leaves. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in coastal dunes and wetlands. Anguillaria biglandulosa plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing habitat for small invertebrates.
